body.p: In 2004 International Social Work established a prize to honour the long period of editorship of the journal by Dr Francis Turner, following his retirement. This prize is awarded annually for the ‘best’ article in each volume and consists of £300 worth of books and/or journals from Sage.

Articles were judged according to the criteria of scholarship, theory or research, originality, comparative content, and international focus, and which reflected the aims and scope of the journal, ‘to explore and promote the development of international social work’. Judging has now been completed for the award of the prize for the best article published in 2011 and the winner is announced below.
‘The problem of contemporary slavery: An international human rights challenge for social work’

p.bold: Congratulations from all at International Social Work
